bib.title: -MEASUREMENT OF THE NB-93(N,INL)NB-93-M CROSS SECTION AT 7.9 MEV.

free_txt: H.LISKIEN AND EXPERIMENTAL SITE.
M.WAGNER, G.WINKLER, H.VONACH.
CN-TYPE VAN DE GRAAFF ACCELERATOR AT GEEL. ABOUT
4 MICRO-AMPS OF DEUTERONS WERE ACCELERATED TO 5.091
N.O.
IF. PAGE OF REFERENCE ADDED
.CORRECTIONS WERE APPLIED FOR SELF-ABSORPTION IN THE
FOILS AND FOR THE EFFECTS OF THE EXTENSION OF THE
SOURCE. FURTHER, THE DATA WERE CORRECTED FOR FLOURE-
SCENCE CAUSED BY TA IMPURITIES IN THE NB SAMPLES, FOR
ELASTIC NEUTRON SCATTERING AND FOR BACKGROUND.
A CALIBRATED SI(LI) X-RAY DETECTOR WAS USED FOR
THE MEASUREMENT OF THE NIOBIUM K-SHELL X-RADIATION.
A FISSION CHAMBER, CONTAINING 168.4 +/- 2.1
MICROGRAMS OF U-238, ENRICHED TO 99.98 PERCENT, IN
FORM OF THE COMPOUND UF4, WAS USED. THE URANIUM
DEPOSIT WAS A 10 MM DIAMETER LAYER ON A 0.2 MM AL
BACKING. THE MASS OF U-238 WAS DETERMINED BY COMPARING
WITH THE ACTIVITY IN AN ALUMINIUM FOIL AFTER
IRRADIATION WITH 14.8 MEV NEUTRONS, USING THE RATIO OF
THE WELL-KNOWN CROSS SECTIONS FOR
13-AL-27(N,A)11-NA-24 AND 92-U-238(N,F). THE CROSS
SECTIONS USED WERE 112.10 MB +/- 0.6 PERCENT AND
1182.7 MB +/- 0.9 PERCENT, RESPECTIVELY.
A 12.7 CM BY 12.7 CM NAI(TL) WELL-TYPE DETECTOR
WAS USED TO MEASURE THE CO-58 ACTIVITY FROM THE NICKEL
FOILS.
THE TA-182 ACTIVITY WAS MEASURED BY MEANS OF A
GE(LI) GAMMA-RAY DETECTOR.
THE ERROR IS COMPOSED OF CONTRIBUTIONS FROM
THE MEASUREMENT OF THE NB-93 ACTIVITY AND FROM FLUENCE
RELATED MEASUREMENTS.
CN-TYPE VAN DE GRAAFF ACCELERATOR AT GEEL. ABOUT
4 MICRO-AMPS OF DEUTERONS WERE ACCELERATED TO 5.091
7.91 MEV NEUTRONS WERE PRODUCED BY THE D(D,N)
REACTION USING A 4 CM LONG AIR-JET COOLED GAS TARGET
CELL, OPERATED AT 1.5E+05 PA GAS PRESSURE, EQUIPPED
WITH A 3.29 MG/CM2 HAVAR ENTRANCE WINDOW AND A 0.5 MM
TA BEAM STOP. A BACKGROUND RUN WAS PERFORMED WITH THE
GAS CELL FILLED WITH HE.
A FISSION CHAMBER WITH NIOBIUM AND MONITOR
FOILS MOUNTED INSIDE AND OUTSIDE THE CHAMBER WAS
PLACED AT 0 DEGREES RELATIVE TO THE DEUTERIUM BEAM AND
AT A DISTANCE OF 6 MM FROM THE TARGET BEAM STOP.
THE NEUTRON FLUENCE DETERMINED
WITH THE 10 MM DIAMETER FISSIONABLE MATERIAL WAS
INTERRELATED TO THE 20 MM DIAMETER NIOBIUM FOILS BY
ALSO IRRADIATING NICKEL FOILS WITH 20 MM DIAMETERS AND
MEASURING THE CENTRAL AND OUTER PARTS SEPARATELY.
.A NIOBIUM FOIL, 20 MM DIAMETER AND 0.13 MM THICK, WITH
A PURITY OF BETTER THAN 99.9 PERCENT, WAS USED. NICKEL
FOILS WERE USED FOR SIZE NORMALISATION. A TANTALUM
FOIL, 20 MM IN DIAMETER AND 0.1 MM THICK WAS USED FOR
DETERMINING THE BACKGROUND FROM TANTALUM IMPURITIES IN
THE NIOBIUM SAMPLES. THE FOILS WERE IRRADIATED FOR 60
HOURS, RESULTING IN A TOTAL NEUTRON FLUENCE OF 5.0E+12
N/CM2.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REF.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REF.
